result.execSummary:
The defendant Kareem C Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kareem C Washington is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kareem C Washington was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All parties appeared by video

03:33 PM Defendant Kareem C Washington by video, in custody, with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video, via Zoom. Rights recited to defendant. Defendant wished to proceed with sentencing today via video. Sentencing is argued. Sentencing recommendations from ADA Long. Connection was interrupted and spotty. Court requested all parties disconnect and call back via zoom. 3:53/4:00 Appearances the same, ADA Long is by phone. ADA Long continued sentencing statement/argument. Sentencing recommendation/argument by Atty Riek. D.T. made a statement to the Court on behalf of the defendant. Defendant made a statement. Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  A civil judgment will be entered for the unpaid financial obligations. 96 days jail credit.

Notice of Certification and Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations sent to 201 Tompkins Srive Apt 2, Madison IW 53716 returned "return to sender, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward"

Cases called: 15CF230, 16CM130 & 16CM131, Defendant Kareem C Washington in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 in 15CF230 and ct. 2 in 16CM130. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. In 15CF230, 2 years probation, $518 costs, submit DNA sample. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. In 16CM130 on ct. 2, 45 days jail, start Dec. 14, 2016 at 7 p.m., may transfer to Dane County Jail on EMP, consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber granted. Submit DNA sample. $443 costs. Court dismissed Cts. 2 &3 in 15CF230 and 16CM131. No jail credit.

Cases called: 15CF230, 16CM130 & 16CM131, Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared, stated defendant's ride for today fell through, requested cases be put on returns for today. Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin, had no objection. Warrant authorized, effective at 4:30 today if defendant doesn't appear.
Bond amended. Defendant may travel to IL for funeral.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
